lines.content: Duke is your personal task manager to help you track different types of tasks. Duke is also a command line interface
application which makes it easy for typing.
1. Ensure you have `Java 11` or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy the jar file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for `Duke`.
4. Open up a terminal/command window at the location where `Duke.jar` is located.
6. The app should load as shown below with the list of commands.
What can I do for you?
List of commands: todo, deadline, event, done, bye
7. Type a command and press `Enter` to execute it.
8. Refer to the [Features](#features) below for details of each command.
Add a Todo task to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Add a Deadline task to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Add an Event task to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
List all the tasks in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Delete task from the task list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Search all the tasks with the keyword found in the task description.
The following tasks have been found:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Duke save files are automatically created when there is no existing save file. When `exit` command is entered,
Duke will automatically `save`, hence there is no need to manually save.
**Q1**: Where is the save file stored or created after I exit the program?
> Save file `duke.txt` is stored in the directory you ran the app in.

public static final String UNKNOWN_COMMAND = "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means =/\n" + DIVIDER_LINE;
public static final String INVALID_TODO = "OOPS!!! Invalid todo description\n" + DIVIDER_LINE;
public static final String INVALID_DEADLINE = "OOPS!!! Invalid deadline description\n" + DIVIDER_LINE;
public static final String INVALID_EVENT = "OOPS!!! Invalid event description\n" + DIVIDER_LINE;
public static final String LIST_EMPTY = "The list is currently empty!\n" + DIVIDER_LINE;
public static final String LIST_FULL = "The list is currently full!\n" + DIVIDER_LINE;
public static final String FILE_SAVED = "File has been saved!";

public static final String FILE_LOADED = "Save file has been loaded!\n" + DIVIDER_LINE;
System.out.println("What can I do for you?\n" + "List of commands: todo, deadline, event, done, bye");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
